title: STEM-in-SEM versus SE-InLens-type-SEM as a Reliable Analytical Pair-Tool for Measurement of Nanoparticle Size and Shape Distribution
content: The accurate dimensional measurement of nanoparticles of complex shape, other than having a spherical shape and a narrow size distribution, is a challenging analytical task for any measurement method. Only imaging methods such as the electron microscopy (operating in different modes) and AFM can address individual nanoparticles with a high accuracy regarding their size and shape. Nevertheless, also with these methods, the devil is in the details. In this paper a systematic study on a well-probed laboratory model nanoparticulate material, TiO2 nanoparticles of bipyramidal shape [1-3], has been caried out with the purpose to quantify the measurement uncertainties induced by using improper analysis conditions. The study has been carried out at an SEM being able to measure the same field-of-view on the sample simultaneously with a detector of SE InLens type and in the transmission mode, i.e. STEM-in-SEM, by using a dedicated transmission sample holder [4].
